Apla for

Blockchain powered government brings a whole new dimension to innovation.

We use our own technology invention — Apla blockchain platform. It’s a secure, fast and agile solution

Decentralisation

All the resources — including data, smart-contracts and user interfaces - are stored on every node inside the network. Any change to data can only be made via smart contract execution. This makes it impossible for anyone in network to tamper with the data.

Security first

The Apla platform was initially design for governments, so security was essential and the first thing to consider. We are working hard to make the Apla blockchain platform completely secure. Only standardised cryptography and hashing algorithms are used, and there is a Bug Bounty program in partnership with HackerOne too.

Rapid application development

App development with Apla doesn’t require any specific knowledge about how P2P networks operate. It allows you to test new ideas and develop Proof of Concepts several times faster. Once dApp development is finished, the dApp can be used on desktop, mobile devices or via web interfaces.

Truly democratic governance

Network governance or critical decision making can be done in a truly democratic manner using the voting mechanism. Once enough users vote, a smart contract is executed automatically to perform the particular action voted for.

Single platform for everything

Everything that is needed for an app to function is already in place, including tools for smart contract development, the building of user interfaces and database table management. This means that you don’t need to write as much code to create your dApp. Moreover, this means that there are fewer potential vulnerabilities in you dApps.

Flexible access rights management

Access rights can be configured for every action, including the execution of smart contracts, editing of any interface or working with data.
You can also allow data to be read from one single table or add new data tables for users who have specific roles, or configure smart contract execution only where specific conditions are met.

Our mission

Smart implementation of blockchain redefines the trust we place in each other, making interactions more transparent, fair and reliable. This is why we will impact on the World Happiness Index, giving everyone access to knowledge, integrating developing countries into the global economy and  bringing joy to people’s lives.

Latest news

Apla Blockchain Database Transaction Speed: 34,000 tx/s

Following testing, Apla’s blockchain platform has managed to achieve a staggering database transaction speed of 34,000 tx/s. This is by no means the limit. Soon Apla will run much faster. For now, we would like to show you the benchmark database, which is integrating into the platform.

Blockchain Ecosystem: What is it About?

As the spark of blockchain revolution is engulfing the world, the technology is becoming more sophisticated as the day goes by. Blockchain engineers the world over are putting thought into turning their product into an engineering marvel and such ideas give rise to buzzwords of the day. Getting a hold on these buzzwords becomes imperative for C-level execs as well as investors so that the knowledge remains perceptible and nothing becomes arcane.

Here is our historyDrag it

2011

Oleg Strelenko, the founder of the project, started creating his own cryptocurrency: DCoin.

April 2014

Release of DCoin: a cryptocurrency viable without exchanges, banks and other mediators. 66 types of transactions, 77 currencies, video identification and an integrated exchange system for converting DCoin into cash.

December 2014

DCoin rewritten from PHP to Go (more than 73,000 lines of code). Works on Win (64/32), OSX (64/32), Linux (64/32), FreeBSD (64/32), Android, IOS, supports PostgreSQL, SQLite, MySQL.

January 2016

DCoin attracts its first investor.

June 2016

Work starts on creating the first blockchain platform prototype as part of the Daylight project. The first office opens in Moscow.

October 2016

The first versions of the web system, plus Simvolio and Prototypo programming languages are created. The project is renamed as eGaaS (electronic Government as a Service).

Spring 2017

The test network is launched. The concept and ideology of smart contracts alongside a platform legal system is developed. The proof of concept for the first projects is validated for the UAE, India and Luxembourg.

July 2017

An office is opened in Luxembourg.

August 2017

The platform’s application is expanded so that it may be implemented outside of eGovernment. Apla is born: a team of experts for developing and integrating blockchain solutions. eGaaS is accepted into the Luxembourg centre for fintech.

Autumn 2017

Proprietary products (programming client, Simvolo and Protypo languages) are perfected. The visual editor and builder for interfaces is created.

By 2018

Apla Enterprise Network (AEN) blockchain network is launched for business. The network speed is increased by 5-10 times (to 1,500 tx/s). Offices open in Dubai, Singapore and New York.
